metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4053 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Squid 3.x before 3.5.17 and 4.x before 4.0.9 allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive stack layout information via crafted Edge Side Includes (ESI) responses, related to incorrect use of assert and compiler optimization.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid-cgi - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid-purge - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid3 - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid3-common - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squidclient - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8').
